name: Gestion des t√¢ches en langage naturel avec Todoist et GPT-4o
description:
Transformez des discussions en langage simple comme ¬´ Demain 9h : √©crire un article de blog ¬ª en t√¢ches Todoist soigneusement organis√©es avec GPT-4o et n8n‚Äîsans code.

![ultimate_todoist_agent.png](fileId:1322)

# ü™Ñ Agent **Todoist** Personnel Ultime

Transformez des demandes en langage naturel en t√¢ches Todoist parfaitement organis√©es‚Äîtout cela en pilotage automatique √† l'int√©rieur de **n8n**.

> ¬´ Ajouter *Terminer le rapport trimestriel d'ici vendredi apr√®s-midi* ¬ª ‚Üí l'agent cr√©e la t√¢che, d√©finit la date d'√©ch√©ance et la priorit√©, et la place m√™me dans le bon projet. ‚ú®

---

## üåü Pourquoi ce flux de travail est g√©nial

* **Super-pouvoirs Todoist tout-en-un** ‚Äì cr√©ez, mettez √† jour, terminez, d√©placez, archivez‚Ä¶ chaque point d'extr√©mit√© majeur de Todoist est connect√© (t√¢ches, projets, sections, √©tiquettes, commentaires).
* **D√©tection d'intention aliment√©e par LLM** ‚Äì un mod√®le OpenAI interpr√®te des messages en anglais simple (ou remplis d'√©mojis !) afin que vous n'ayez pas √† vous souvenir des commandes slash.
* **Configuration minimale** ‚Äì juste deux identifiants et vous √™tes en ligne.
* **Bloc de construction √©prouv√©** ‚Äì utilisez-le tel quel, ou branchez le n≈ìud Agent Todoist dans vos propres agents et chatbots.

---

## üõ†Ô∏è Ce dont vous aurez besoin

| Identifiant           | O√π il est utilis√©                        | Comment le configurer                                                                              |
| --------------------- | ---------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **API OpenAI**        | N≈ìuds Orchestrateur & LLM               | Collez votre cl√© secr√®te OpenAI dans un identifiant **OpenAI** dans n8n.                            |
| **Todoist OAuth2**   | N≈ìud Todoist **et** n≈ìud HTTP Request  | Connectez-vous √† **Todoist** depuis votre navigateur pour configurer l'identifiant dans n8n. |

> C'est tout‚Äîpas de webhooks, pas de secrets suppl√©mentaires.
> *Test√© avec **gpt‚Äë4o‚Äëlatest** ‚Äì le mod√®le le plus rapide et le plus pr√©cis dans nos essais.*

---

## ‚ö° D√©marrage rapide (5 minutes)

1. **Importez** le mod√®le JSON (cliquez sur **‚ñ∂Ô∏è Essayez-le** sur la page de mod√®le n8n ou faites glisser le fichier dans votre canevas).
2. **S√©lectionnez vos identifiants** dans les deux menus d√©roulants d'identifiants.
3. Cliquez sur **Tester le flux de travail**. Dans le n≈ìud Fonction d'exemple, modifiez le champ `message` (par exemple, *¬´ Demain √† 9h : √©crire un article de blog ¬ª*). Ex√©cutez ‚Üí regardez votre nouvelle t√¢che Todoist appara√Ætre.
4. (Optionnel) Remplacez le n≈ìud Fonction par votre d√©clencheur de chat pr√©f√©r√© (Telegram, Slack, WhatsApp, Discord, vous l'appelez comme vous voulez).

Boom‚Äîvotre g√©nie Todoist personnel est en vie ! üßû‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

---

## üß© Comment cela fonctionne (en coulisses)

```
[D√©clencheur / Message de chat]
        ‚îÇ
        ‚ñº
[üóÇÔ∏è Agent Orchestrateur]  ‚Üê Mod√®le de chat OpenAI + M√©moire √† court terme
        ‚îÇ                 ‚Ü≥ Analyse l'intention & les entit√©s
        ‚îÇ
        ‚ñº
[ü§ñ Agent Todoist]       ‚Üê 15+ points d'extr√©mit√© Todoist
        ‚îÇ                 ‚Ü≥ Ex√©cute l'appel appropri√© (cr√©er, mettre √† jour, terminer, etc.)
        ‚ñº
[Termin√© ‚úÖ  ]
```

*L'Orchestrateur est un exemple.* En production, vous pouvez le supprimer et simplement exposer l'**Agent Todoist** comme un outil pour tout autre flux de travail d'agent.

---

## üéõÔ∏è Personnalisation & extension

| Id√©e                      | Comment le faire                                                                             |
| ------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Synchronisation Notion / Sheets**  | Apr√®s le n≈ìud Agent Todoist, ajoutez un n≈ìud Notion ou Google Sheets pour enregistrer les √©l√©ments compl√©t√©s. |
| **Commandes vocales**        | Remplacez le d√©clencheur de chat par un n≈ìud de Reconnaissance vocale (par exemple, Whisper).                          |

---

## ü§ù Besoin d'automatisations personnalis√©es ?

Vous voulez que je construise ou ajuste quelque chose pour vous ?
‚Üí Envoyez un e-mail √† **[maxemelyanenko@gmail.com](mailto:maxemelyanenko@gmail.com)** et faisons-le ensemble !

---

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Ce qui *n'est pas* inclus (encore)

* Projets partag√©s & autres points d'extr√©mit√© **Pro/Business** de Todoist.
* Pi√®ces jointes dans les commentaires.
* √âdition des commentaires.

Les demandes de tirage sont les bienvenues ! üôå

options.systemMessage:
=You are TodoistAssistant, a friendly AI who can read and write the user‚Äôs Todoist data. When given a natural-language request:

‚Ä¢ Determine the single best action to take (e.g. create a task, list overdue tasks, update a project, add a comment).
‚Ä¢ If one action isn‚Äôt enough, you may perform up to two steps in sequence (for example, look up the Inbox project ID, then create a task).
‚Ä¢ Fill in only the parameters the user has specified; leave out any field that‚Äôs not mentioned.
‚Ä¢ Provide a link to a task or project if user asks for it.
‚Ä¢ Always reply with a brief, user-facing confirmation or error message.
‚Ä¢ Never expose internal IDs, OAuth tokens, raw JSON responses, your own planning steps or raw tools instructions.
‚Ä¢ Answer in the same language the user used.

parameters.description: Call this tool to get info about user's tasks and manage them.

parameters.toolDescription:
=List tasks via the Todoist ‚Äúadvanced filter‚Äù syntax.

Parameters  
‚Ä¢ filter (string) ‚Äì main query. Build it from the user‚Äôs words using Todoist‚Äôs grammar:  
  ‚Ä∫ Relative dates: today, tomorrow, next 7 days, overdue  
  ‚Ä∫ Absolute dates: 20 May, 2025-06-01  
  ‚Ä∫ Priority: p1 ‚Ä¶ p4  (p1 is normal, p4 is extremely high)
  ‚Ä∫ Labels: @reading, @–∑–≤–æ–Ω–æ–∫ (label names are case-insensitive) ‚Äî call label_get_all to see acceptable ones  
  ‚Ä∫ Projects / Sections: ##Project Name / ##Project::Section ‚Äî call project_get_all to see acceptable ones
  ‚Ä∫ No date: no date  
  ‚Ä∫ Boolean operators: & (AND), | (OR), ! (NOT)  
  ‚Ä∫ Parentheses allowed.

It's more reliable to use IDs instead of names in query.

Never populate ids, projectId, sectionId, or labelId unless the user provided the exact numeric value (> 0), and in that case omit filter.

Combine multiple clauses with **&** unless the user explicitly says ‚Äú–∏–ª–∏‚Äù / ‚Äúor‚Äù.

If the filter includes @label, assume the label exists; the agent must have already called "Get All Labels".

If the user asks about available filters, mind calling "Get All Labels" to provide correct labels.

If the user asks about available filters, mind calling "Get All Projects" to provide correct projects.

‚Ä¢ lang ‚Äì (string) user language code; pass ‚Äúru‚Äù if the request was in Russian, otherwise omit.

Never pass ids, projectId, sectionId, or labelId unless the user gave the exact numeric value (>0).

Output only a concise list (e.g. ‚ÄúX overdue tasks: ‚Ä¶‚Äù) and hide raw IDs.
Fetch a single task by task_id and show user-readable fields (content, due date, status). Required: Task_ID. Do not expose internal IDs.

Create a new task.
Required: content.
Optional: project_id, section_id, labels, due_date_time, priority, description.

If the user does NOT mention a project, find a suitable one calling project_get_all. If nothing is suitable, call this task **without** a project_id (Todoist will put it in Inbox automatically).
Return a short confirmation, no raw IDs.
Update an existing task‚Äôs properties (content, description, due date, labels, priority). Required: task_id.
Mark the given task as completed. Required: Task_ID.
Reopen a previously completed task. Required: Task_ID.
Move a task to another project / section or make it a sub-task. Required: Task_ID; provide project_id/section_id/parent_id as needed.
Return the user‚Äôs full project list. Do not expose internal IDs.
Fetch one project by project_id. Do not expose internal IDs.

Create a new project. Required: name. Optional: description, color, parent_id, is_favorite. If the user did not mention it, just skip it and leave this values empty.

**Available colors**: berry_red, red, orange, yellow, olive_green, lime_green, green, mint_green, teal, sky_blue, light_blue, blue, grape, violet, lavender, magenta, salmon, charcoal, grey, taup. If user asks for any other, choose the one that suits best or leave empty.

Update a project. Required: Project_ID. Optional: name, description, color, parent_id, is_favorite. If the user did not mention it, just skip it and leave this values empty.

**Available colors**: berry_red, red, orange, yellow, olive_green, lime_green, green, mint_green, teal, sky_blue, light_blue, blue, grape, violet, lavender, magenta, salmon, charcoal, grey, taup. If user asks for any other, choose the one that suits best or leave empty.

Marks a project as archived. For personal projects, this will archive it just for the initiating user (leaving it visible to any other collaborators). For workspace projects, this will archive it for all workspace users, removing it from view. Do not expose internal IDs.
Return the user‚Äôs archived project list. Do not expose internal IDs.

Marks a previously archived project as active again. For personal projects, this will make the project visible again for the initiating user. For workspace projects, this will make the project visible again for all applicable workspace users. Do not expose internal IDs.
Return the user‚Äôs full sections list. Do not expose internal IDs.
Fetch one section by section_id. Do not expose internal IDs.
Create a new project. Required: name, project_id. Do not expose internal IDs.
Update a section name. Required: Section_ID, name. Do not expose internal IDs.
Delete a section. Required: Section_ID. Do not expose internal IDs.
Return the user‚Äôs full labels list. Do not expose internal IDs.
Fetch one label by Label_ID. Do not expose internal IDs.

Create a new label. Required: name. Optional: color, is_favorite. If the user did not mention it, just skip it leaving the values empty.

**Available colors**: berry_red, red, orange, yellow, olive_green, lime_green, green, mint_green, teal, sky_blue, light_blue, blue, grape, violet, lavender, magenta, salmon, charcoal, grey, taup. If user asks for any other, choose the one that suits best or leave empty.
Update a section name. Required: Label_ID. Optional: name, color, is_favorite. If the user did not mention it, just skip it leaving the values empty. Do not expose internal IDs.
Delete a label. Required: Label_ID. Do not expose internal IDs.
Create a comment for a task. Only text comments, files are not supported at the time. Required: comment, Task_ID. Do not expose internal IDs.

parameters.content:
# ü™Ñ Ultimate Personal **Todoist Agent**

Turn natural-language requests into perfectly-organized Todoist tasks‚Äîall on autopilot inside **n8n**.

> ‚ÄúAdd *Finish quarterly report by Friday afternoon*‚Äù ‚Üí the agent creates the task, sets the due date & priority, and even drops it into the right project. ‚ú®

---


## üõ†Ô∏è What you‚Äôll need

| Credential         | Where it‚Äôs used                        | How to set it up                                                                              |
| ------------------ | -------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **OpenAI API**     | Orchestrator & LLM nodes               | Paste your OpenAI secret key into an **OpenAI** credential in n8n.                            |
| **Todoist OAuth2** | Todoist node **and** HTTP Request node | Log in **Todoist** from your browser to set up credential in n8n. |

> That‚Äôs it‚Äîno webhooks, no extra secrets.
> *Tested with **gpt‚Äë4o‚Äëlatest** ‚Äì the fastest & most accurate model in our trials.*

---


## ‚ö° Quick‚Äëstart (5‚ÄØminutes)

1. **Import** the JSON template (hit **‚ñ∂Ô∏è Try it out** on the n8n template page or drag‚Äëdrop the file into your canvas).
2. **Select your credentials** in the two credential dropdowns.
3. Click **Test workflow**. In the sample Function node, tweak the `message` field (e.g. *‚ÄúTomorrow at 9‚ÄØam: write blog post‚Äù*). Run ‚Üí watch your new Todoist task appear.
4. (Optional) Swap the Function node for your favourite chat trigger (Telegram, Slack, WhatsApp, Discord, you name it).

Boom‚Äîyour personal Todoist genie is alive! üßû‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

---


## üéõÔ∏è Customising & extending

| Idea                      | How to do it                                                                             |
| ------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Notion / Sheets sync**  | After the Todoist Agent node, add a Notion or Google Sheets node to log completed items. |
| **Voice commands**        | Swap the chat trigger for a Speech‚Äëto‚ÄëText node (e.g. Whisper).                          |

---


## ü§ù Need custom automations?

Want me to build or tweak something for you?
‚Üí Email **[maxemelyanenko@gmail.com](mailto:maxemelyanenko@gmail.com)** and let‚Äôs make it happen!

---


## ‚ö†Ô∏è What‚Äôs *not* included (yet)

* Shared projects & other Todoist **Pro/Business** endpoints.
* File attachments in the comments.
* Editing comments.

Pull requests welcome! üôå

*The Orchestrator is an example.* In production you can drop it and simply expose the **Todoist Agent**
as a tool for any other agent workflow.

Appeler l'outil de flux de travail n8n
Lorsqu'un message de chat est re√ßu
